TITLE: Mint Response Format in Starknet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: Response from the mint request showing the new balance after minting, the unit used (WEI or FRI), and the transaction hash of the minting operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.1/balance.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "new_balance": 500000,
    "unit": "WEI" | "FRI",
    "tx_hash": "0xa24f23..."
}
```

TITLE: Using a Custom Account Class via CLI in StarkNet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: Specify a custom account contract implementation by providing the path to its compiled Sierra artifact using the `--account-class-custom` command-line option when launching StarkNet Devnet. Requires a valid path to a Sierra JSON file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.3/predeployed.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
--account-class-custom <SIERRA_PATH>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Requesting Devnet State Dump via CLI
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to manually request a dump through CLI by sending a POST request to '/dump' endpoint without a body or specifying the 'devnet_dump' method via JSON-RPC. The optional 'path' parameter allows specifying dump destination, overriding startup settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.1/dump-load-restart.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
POST /dump
{
  // optional; defaults to the path specified via CLI if defined
  "path": <PATH>
}
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_dump"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring State Archive Capacity with Starknet Devnet - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This shell command starts the Starknet Devnet with a specified state archive capacity using the --state-archive-capacity flag. Setting the capacity to 'full' enables storing the complete state history, allowing queries on previous states by block hash or number. Requires Starknet Devnet to be installed and available on the system path. The <CAPACITY> parameter should be replaced with the desired archive mode (e.g., 'full' or 'none'). The command configures the node prior to startup, and historical state queries are only possible if archive capacity is set to 'full'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.1/historic-state.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet --state-archive-capacity <CAPACITY>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Set Time - JSON-RPC - Starknet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: Sets the exact time for the next block and generates a new block immediately using a JSON-RPC request. The `time` parameter (in Unix time seconds) must be included within the `params` object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.4.0/starknet-time.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
JSON-RPC
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_setTime",
    "params": {
        "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Docker Environment File Format for Starknet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: Example of environment variable configuration file format for Docker. Unlike the direct execution format, Docker environment files should not include the export keyword.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/running/cli.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
SEED=42
ACCOUNTS=3
...
```

TITLE: Solidity Contract Constructor for L1-L2 Messaging Example - Solidity
DESCRIPTION: Defines a contract constructor in Solidity that initializes with a reference to an IStarknetCore contract. This establishes the L1-L2 bridge mechanism for message passing on standard Starknet deployments. Input: starknetCore_ (IStarknetCore contract). Sets internal storage for future messaging.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.3.0/postman.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: solidity
CODE:
```
constructor(IStarknetCore starknetCore_) public {
    starknetCore = starknetCore_;
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Account Class in Starknet Devnet using CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command line options for selecting between Cairo 0 or Cairo 1 account implementations when starting Starknet Devnet. The default is Cairo 1 (OpenZeppelin 0.8.1).

LANGUAGE: bash

```
--account-class [cairo0 | cairo1]
```

TITLE: Specifying Custom Account Class Sierra Artifact Path in CLI
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates using the `--account-class-custom` option to provide a path to the Sierra artifact of a custom account. This allows users to deploy a custom account contract, instead of relying on the default predeployed ones.  The input is the path to the compiled Sierra artifact. No direct dependencies are apparent from the command itself, but it requires having a Sierra artifact from a compiled Cairo contract.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.6/predeployed.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
--account-class-custom <SIERRA_PATH>
```

TITLE: Running Dockerized Starknet Devnet with Environment Variables
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to pass environment variables to a Docker container running Starknet Devnet. The `-e` flag is used to specify each environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.1/running/cli.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker run \
    -e <VAR1>=<VALUE> \
    -e <VAR2>=<VALUE> \
    ... \
    shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs
```

TITLE: Requesting a Dump via HTTP/JSON-RPC - Starknet Devnet - JSON
DESCRIPTION: These JSON and HTTP snippets show how to trigger a state dump of Starknet Devnet either via a POST HTTP request or using a JSON-RPC call. The basic POST /dump endpoint requires no body to dump to a path configured at startup, while passing a 'path' parameter in the body allows specifying a custom output file. For JSON-RPC, the method is 'devnet_dump' with an optional 'path' parameter. Input includes the endpoint and optionally the file path; output is either a file or the raw dump in the response. Dependencies: a running Devnet instance with proper dump-on mode enabled.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/dump-load-restart.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
POST /dump
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_dump"
}
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "path": <PATH>
}
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_dump",
    "params": {
        "path": <PATH>
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Requests server configuration details using JSON-RPC by sending a request with method `devnet_getConfig`. The response includes the `server_config` property, which contains the configuration data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.3.0/server-config.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_getConfig"
}
```

TITLE: Dumping Starknet-Devnet State After Each Block
DESCRIPTION: Command for automatically dumping Starknet-Devnet state after each block is created, ensuring continuous preservation of the blockchain state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.3/dump-load-restart.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:

```
$ starknet-devnet --dump-on block --dump-path <PATH>
```

TITLE: Running Starknet Devnet in Lite Mode
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to launch the Starknet Devnet with the `--lite-mode` flag enabled.  Enabling lite mode skips block hash calculation, offering a faster startup and execution for use-cases where these features are not required. This reduces computational overhead.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.2/lite.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet --lite-mode
```

TITLE: Configuring Dockerized Devnet with Individual Environment Variables (-e) (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to pass individual environment variables to a Docker container using the '-e' flag during 'docker run'. Each variable is specified with '-e VAR=VALUE'. This is the standard Docker way to inject environment variables for configuring the application running inside the container and is suitable for passing a few specific settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.3.0/running/cli.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
$ docker run \
    -e <VAR1>=<VALUE> \
    -e <VAR2>=<VALUE> \
    ... \
    shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs
```

TITLE: Check Balance via GET Request - Starknet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to check an account balance by sending a GET request to `/account_balance`. It includes the address parameter and optional parameters for the unit (WEI or FRI) and the block tag (latest or pending). It retrieves the account balance from the Starknet Devnet. Requires an HTTP client.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.3.0/balance.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
GET /account_balance?address=<ADDRESS>[&unit=<FRI|WEI>][&block_tag=<latest|pending>]
```

TITLE: Sending Mock L1->L2 Transaction with JSON-RPC - JSON
DESCRIPTION: Uses JSON-RPC method 'devnet_postmanSendMessageToL2' to simulate an L1->L2 message. Parameters mirror the REST example and include all fields for contract and entry point addresses, payload, paid fee, and nonce. Returns transaction result with hash string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.2/postman.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_postmanSendMessageToL2",
    "params": {
      "l2_contract_address": "0x00285ddb7e5c777b310d806b9b2a0f7c7ba0a41f12b420219209d97a3b7f25b2",
      "entry_point_selector": "0xC73F681176FC7B3F9693986FD7B14581E8D540519E27400E88B8713932BE01",
      "l1_contract_address": "0xe7f1725E7734CE288F8367e1Bb143E90bb3F0512",
      "payload": [
        "0x1",
        "0x2"
      ],
      "paid_fee_on_l1": "0x123456abcdef",
      "nonce":"0x0"
  }
}
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{ "transaction_hash": "0x0548c761a9fd5512782998b2da6f44c42bf78fb88c3794eea330a91c9abb10bb" }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Starknet Devnet Time via POST Request
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set the exact time in Starknet devnet using a POST request to the `/set_time` endpoint. The request body should include the `time` parameter, representing the desired Unix timestamp in seconds. This will generate a new block with the specified timestamp.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/starknet-time.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
POST /set_time
{
    "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS
}
```

TITLE: Fetching and Running Pre-Compiled Starknet Devnet Binary in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Downloads a compressed platform-specific pre-compiled binary release of starknet-devnet from the GitHub releases page using curl, then extracts it to a target directory, and finally runs the executable from that directory. This skips compilation to save installation time. Requires curl, tar, and correct URL/version/filename substitutions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.1/running/install.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl https://github.com/0xSpaceShard/starknet-devnet/releases/download/<VERSION>/<COMPRESSED_ARCHIVE> | tar -xvzf - -C <TARGET_DIR>
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
<TARGET_DIR>/starknet-devnet
```

TITLE: Running the Installed Starknet Devnet Executable
DESCRIPTION: Executes the `starknet-devnet` binary after it has been installed, typically via `cargo install`. Assumes the installation directory (e.g., `~/.cargo/bin`) is included in the system's PATH environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.7/running/install.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet
```

TITLE: Calling devnet_impersonateAccount JSON-RPC
DESCRIPTION: This JSON-RPC request instructs Starknet Devnet to impersonate a specific account address that does not exist in the local state. This allows transactions from this account to be processed without signature validation, provided Devnet is running in forking mode. The required parameter is the `account_address` to be impersonated. The method returns an empty JSON object upon success.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.0/account-impersonation.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_impersonateAccount",
    "params": {
        "account_address": "0x49D36570D4E46F48E99674BD3FCC84644DDD6B96F7C741B1562B82F9E004DC7"
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Mocking L2 to L1 message sending via JSON-RPC devnet_postmanConsumeMessageFromL2
DESCRIPTION: This request enables simulation of an L2 contract-initiated message to L1 by providing sender, recipient, and payload. It requires a running L1 node and is used for testing messaging in dev environments, producing a message hash for tracking. The RPC method is 'devnet_postmanConsumeMessageFromL2'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/postman.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_postmanConsumeMessageFromL2",
    "params": {
      "from_address": "0x00285ddb7e5c777b310d806b9b2a0f7c7ba0a41f12b420219209d97a3b7f25b2",
      "to_address": "0xe7f1725E7734CE288F8367e1Bb143E90bb3F0512",
      "payload": ["0x0", "0x1", "0x3e8"]
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Server Configuration via REST API
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to retrieve the current server configuration using a GET request to the /config endpoint and filtering the result to show only the server_config property.

CODE:
```
$ curl localhost:5050/config | jq .server_config
```

This response helps users understand the operational parameters of their Devnet setup.

TITLE: Minting Tokens Using JSON-RPC in Starknet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: Sends a JSON-RPC request with method devnet_mint to add funds to an account. Parameters include address, amount, and unit (WEI or FRI). Used as an alternative to the REST API endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.1/balance.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_mint",
    "params": {
        "address": "0x6e3205f...",
        "amount": 500000,
        "unit": "WEI" | "FRI"
    }
}
```

DESCRIPTION: Runs the Devnet server inside a Docker container with the desired logging level set via environment variables. Demonstrates the use of docker run with environment variable setting for RUST_LOG.


TITLE: Stop Impersonating Account - JSON-RPC Request (JavaScript)
DESCRIPTION: This JSON-RPC request stops the impersonation of a previously impersonated account. It uses the `devnet_stopImpersonateAccount` method. The `account_address` parameter specifies the account to stop impersonating.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_stopImpersonateAccount",
    "params": {
        "account_address": "0x49D36570D4E46F48E99674BD3FCC84644DDD6B96F7C741B1562B82F9E004DC7"
    }
}
```

TITLE: Start Time - CLI - Starknet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: Defines the starting timestamp for the devnet via the command line interface. This timestamp is used for mining the genesis block.  If not provided, the current Unix time is used.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.4.0/starknet-time.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet --start-time <SECONDS>
```

TITLE: Configuring Server Timeout for Starknet Devnet (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Uses the --timeout command-line argument to set the maximum duration (in seconds) an HTTP request can be served by Starknet Devnet. Replace <SECONDS> with the desired timeout value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/server-config.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet --timeout <SECONDS>
```

TITLE: Loading Devnet Config from File and Running (Subshell) (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to source an environment file and run Starknet Devnet within a subshell created using parentheses '()'. This technique ensures that the variables sourced from the file are only set within the subshell's environment and are automatically unset when the subshell exits, preventing pollution of the parent shell's environment. Useful for isolated configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.3.0/running/cli.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
$ ( source .my-env-file && starknet-devnet )
```


TITLE: Running Starknet Devnet with specific host and port mapping
DESCRIPTION: This command runs Starknet Devnet and maps the container's internal port 5050 to a specific IP address and port on the host machine (in this case 127.0.0.1:5050). This makes the Devnet instance accessible on the specified host and port.

LANGUAGE: text


TITLE: Requesting Block Creation (JSON-RPC)
DESCRIPTION: Sends a JSON-RPC request to the Devnet node to trigger the creation of a new block. This block will include all pending transactions received since the last block was mined.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.2/blocks.md#_snippet_1

```
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_createBlock"
}
```

TITLE: Pulling Docker Image with Seed Account

LANGUAGE: text


----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Devnet with Periodic Block Generation (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Starts StarkNet Devnet using the `starknet-devnet` command with the `--block-generation-on <INTERVAL>` option. This enables automatic block creation every `<INTERVAL>` seconds, combining features of 'demand' mode with periodic mining. The example demonstrates how transactions sent between intervals are bundled into the next automatically generated block, and how manual block creation interacts with the timer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.4/blocks.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
# t
$ starknet-devnet --block-generation-on 10

# t + 1s
# user: send tx1

# t + 4s
# user: send tx2

# t + 10s
# Devnet: block automatically generated, contains tx1 and tx2

# t + 12s
# user: send tx3

# t + 14s
# user: invoke empty block creation
# Devnet: generated block contains tx3

# t + 20s
# Devnet: block automatically generated, contains no txs (manual creation did not restart the counter)
```

```
}
```

Returns the transaction hash. Invalid addresses prevent block generation.

```
{
    "l2_contract_address": "0x00285ddb7e5c777b310d806b9b2a0f7c7ba0a41f12b420219209d97a3b7f25b2",
    "entry_point_selector": "0xC73F681176FC7B3F9693986FD7B14581E8D540519E27400E88B8713932BE01",
    "l1_contract_address": "0xe7f1725E7734CE288F8367e1Bb143E90bb3F0512",
    "payload": [
      "0x1",
      "0x2"
    ],
    "paid_fee_on_l1": "0x123456abcdef",
```

TITLE: Loading Messaging Contract via Starknet Devnet Postman (REST, JSON-RPC, JSON)
DESCRIPTION: These requests load a MockStarknetMessaging contract for testing L1-L2 message passing. The REST endpoint expects a POST request to /postman/load_l1_messaging_contract with JSON specifying networkUrl (L1 node's RPC URL) and an optional address of an existing messaging contract. The JSON-RPC alternative calls devnet_postmanLoad with similar parameters. Dependencies include a running Devnet and an L1 node. Inputs: networkUrl (required), address (optional). Outputs signal successful contract loading. Valid L1 node RPC endpoints are required.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/postman.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
POST /postman/load_l1_messaging_contract
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "networkUrl": "http://localhost:8545",
  "address": "0x123...def"
}
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_postmanLoad",
    "params": {
      "networkUrl": "http://localhost:8545",
      "address": "0x123...def"
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Invokes the 'devnet_postmanLoad' JSON-RPC method to load the messaging contract. Includes required 'network_url' and an optional 'address' in the 'params' field. Returns standard JSON-RPC responses on success or error. Prerequisites are a running Devnet instance and access to a valid L1 node endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.2/postman.md#_snippet_1

CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_postmanLoad",
    "params": {
      "network_url": "http://localhost:8545",
      "address": "0x123...def"
    }
}
```

TITLE: Increasing Time in Starknet Devnet (JSON-RPC)
DESCRIPTION: Increases the block timestamp via the JSON-RPC `devnet_increaseTime` method. The method uses a `time` parameter to determine how many seconds to increment the time by, generating a new block. Subsequent blocks will inherit the increment. Input: `time` (in seconds). Output: Generates a new block.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.1/starknet-time.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
JSON-RPC
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_increaseTime",
    "params": {
        "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS
    }
}
```

TITLE: Enabling Starknet Devnet Restrictive Mode with Method List (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to enable restrictive mode with a specified list of methods.  The command `starknet-devnet --restrictive-mode devnet_dump devnet_config` restricts the specified methods `devnet_dump` and `devnet_config`.  If the specified method or route is misspelled, then Devnet will fail to start. This command allows for finer control over what methods are restricted during Devnet operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/restrictive.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet --restrictive-mode devnet_dump devnet_config
```

TITLE: Downloading and Running a Pre-compiled StarkNet Devnet Binary
DESCRIPTION: Downloads a specific version's pre-compiled, compressed archive from GitHub releases using `curl`, extracts it to a target directory (`<TARGET_DIR>`) using `tar`, and then executes the binary. Replace `<VERSION>`, `<COMPRESSED_ARCHIVE>`, and `<TARGET_DIR>` with appropriate values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.1/running/install.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ curl -sSfL https://github.com/0xSpaceShard/starknet-devnet/releases/download/<VERSION>/<COMPRESSED_ARCHIVE> | tar -xvz -C <TARGET_DIR>
$ <TARGET_DIR>/starknet-devnet
```

TITLE: Setting Starknet Devnet Time without Block Generation via POST
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set the exact time in Starknet devnet for the next block generation, without immediately generating a new block. It uses a POST request to the `/set_time` endpoint with `generate_block` set to `false`.  The next block will then use specified timestamp.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/starknet-time.md#_snippet_2

TITLE: Docker Load example - Starknet Devnet (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This docker run command demonstrates loading a previously dumped Devnet state from a specified path.  It utilizes bind mounts to map a host directory to a container directory, enabling the Devnet to access the dump file. It requires the path to the dump file and is using shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs docker image. This is a practical example showing how to load the dump in Docker. It listens to the port 5050 on the host machine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.2/dump-load-restart.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
docker run \
  -p 127.0.0.1:5050:5050 \
  --mount type=bind,source=/path/to/dumpdir,target=/path/to/dumpdir \
  shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs \
  --dump-path /path/to/dumpdir/mydump
```

TITLE: Checking Balance via JSON-RPC - Starknet Devnet - JSON
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates using the devnet_getAccountBalance method in a JSON-RPC request to retrieve the balance of a specified account. Parameters must include the address (0x-prefixed hex), and can include unit (WEI or FRI) and block_tag (latest or pending). The jsonrpc version, method name, and request id are mandatory fields. This call returns the account balance in the requested unit and block state context.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/balance.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json

```

    "jsonrpc": "2.0",

    "params": {
        "address": "0x6e3205f...",
```

TITLE: Illustrating Periodic Block Generation in StarkNet Devnet (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the behavior of StarkNet Devnet when started with periodic block generation (`--block-generation-on <INTERVAL>`). Shows how transactions sent by users are batched and included in blocks automatically at the specified interval (10 seconds in this example). It also illustrates how manual block creation (invoked at t+14s) interacts with the automatic timer, which still triggers at the next scheduled interval (t+20s).
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/blocks.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
# t
$ starknet-devnet --block-generation-on 10

# t + 1s
# user: send tx1

# t + 4s
# user: send tx2

# t + 10s
# Devnet: block automatically generated, contains tx1 and tx2

# t + 12s
# user: send tx3

# t + 14s
# user: invoke empty block creation
# Devnet: generated block contains tx3

# t + 20s
# Devnet: block automatically generated, contains no txs (manual creation did not restart the counter)
```

Replace '<HOST>', '<PORT>', and '<PATH>' for your environment.

LANGUAGE: bash

```
$ starknet-devnet --dump-on exit --dump-path <PATH>
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

```

TITLE: Setting Exact Block Time via Starknet Devnet POST /set_time (HTTP/JSON)
DESCRIPTION: Sets the blockchain time to a specified Unix timestamp and optionally generates a new block immediately. This endpoint accepts a JSON payload with a required 'time' parameter (Unix time in seconds) and an optional 'generate_block' boolean parameter that defaults to true. If 'generate_block' is false, no block is generated immediately, but the timestamp will be applied to the next block. Users must be cautious as setting a block time in the past can cause unexpected behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.7/starknet-time.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: HTTP/JSON
CODE:
```
POST /set_time
{
    "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS
}
```

LANGUAGE: HTTP/JSON
CODE:
```
POST /set_time
{
    "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS,
    "generate_block": false
}
```

DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to pull Docker images that come preloaded with funded test accounts, by appending the '-seed0' suffix. It supports both version-tagged and latest images. Docker must be installed. When used, running containers from these images provides deterministic predeployed accounts for development and testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/running/docker.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ docker pull shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs:<VERSION>-seed0
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ docker pull shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs:latest-seed0
```

TITLE: Running a Starknet Devnet Docker container
DESCRIPTION: This command runs a Starknet Devnet Docker container, publishing the container's port 5050 to a specified port on the host machine. The `[HOST:]<PORT>` part needs to be replaced with the desired host address and port.  `[OPTIONS]` represents the command line options available for Starknet Devnet.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.0/running/docker.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
$ docker run -p [HOST:]<PORT>:5050 shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs [OPTIONS]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sending Mock L2 to L1 Message with JSON-RPC in JSON
DESCRIPTION: Example of sending a mock L2 to L1 message using the JSON-RPC interface. This performs the same function as the REST endpoint but follows JSON-RPC protocol standards.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.4.0/postman.md#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_postmanConsumeMessageFromL2",
    "params": {
      "from_address": "0x00285ddb7e5c777b310d806b9b2a0f7c7ba0a41f12b420219209d97a3b7f25b2",
      "to_address": "0xe7f1725E7734CE288F8367e1Bb143E90bb3F0512",
      "payload": ["0x0", "0x1", "0x3e8"],
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Exact Time without Block Generation via JSON-RPC
DESCRIPTION: The JSON-RPC equivalent for setting exact time without immediate block generation. Uses the devnet_setTime method with generate_block parameter set to false.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.3.0/starknet-time.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_setTime",
    "params": {
        "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS,
        "generate_block": false
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Constructor Example for MockStarknetMessaging in Solidity
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to replace the standard StarknetCore contract with a MockStarknetMessaging contract in a Solidity constructor, enabling local Devnet L1-L2 interaction testing. This modification is required because Devnet uses a mock contract to simulate messaging instead of the production IStarknetCore interface.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.1/postman.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Solidity
CODE:
```
constructor(MockStarknetMessaging mockStarknetMessaging_) public {
    starknetCore = mockStarknetMessaging_;
}
```

TITLE: Setting Time via JSON-RPC with Block Generation in Starknet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: Sets the exact block and state timestamp using the `devnet_setTime` JSON-RPC method. This call includes the desired time parameter and triggers immediate generation of a new block.

LANGUAGE: JSON-RPC

```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_setTime",
    "params": {
        "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS
    }
}
```

TITLE: Dumping State on Exit with Starknet Devnet (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: This Bash command runs Starknet Devnet and configures it to save its internal state to a specified path when the process exits (e.g., via Ctrl+C/SIGINT). It requires the 'starknet-devnet' binary and a writable disk location for dump data. The '--dump-on exit' flag ensures the dump occurs on normal shutdown, but does not handle forced termination (SIGKILL). The key parameter '--dump-path' specifies the disk path where the dump will be stored.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.6/dump-load-restart.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet --dump-on exit --dump-path <PATH>
```

TITLE: Calling devnet_stopImpersonateAccount JSON-RPC
DESCRIPTION: This JSON-RPC request commands Starknet Devnet to cease impersonating a specific account that was previously marked for impersonation using `devnet_impersonateAccount`. It requires the `account_address` parameter specifying which account to stop impersonating. The method returns an empty JSON object indicating the operation's success.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.0/account-impersonation.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_stopImpersonateAccount",
    "params": {
        "account_address": "0x49D36570D4E46F48E99674BD3FCC84644DDD6B96F7C741B1562B82F9E004DC7"
    }
}
```

TITLE: Invoking JSON-RPC Method to Check Account Balance - JSON-RPC
DESCRIPTION: This JSON-RPC request structure invokes the `devnet_getAccountBalance` method to retrieve the balance of a specific account. The `params` object requires the `address` and optionally accepts `unit` (defaulting to WEI) and `block_tag` (defaulting to latest) to filter the balance query by token type and block state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.3/balance.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: JSON-RPC
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_getAccountBalance",
    "params": {
        "address": "0x6e3205f...",
        "unit": "WEI" | "FRI",
        "block_tag": "latest" | "pending"
    }
}
```

TITLE: Flushing message queues with dry run option
DESCRIPTION: This request allows simulating the flush operation without actual message delivery by setting 'dry_run' to true. Useful for testing the effect of flushing without changing state. It relies on the JSON-RPC method 'devnet_postmanFlush' with an optional parameter.

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",

    "params": {
      "dry_run": true
    }
}
```

TITLE: Check Balance Request - Starknet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates a `GET` request to `/account_balance` to retrieve the token balance of a given address on Starknet Devnet. The request includes the `address`, and optionally, `unit` and `block_tag` parameters. The address should be a 0x-prefixed hex string, `unit` defaults to `WEI`, and `block_tag` to `latest`. The API retrieves account balance for provided token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.6/balance.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: API
CODE:
```
GET /account_balance?address=<ADDRESS>[&unit=<FRI|WEI>][&block_tag=<latest|pending>]
```

TITLE: Increasing Block Time (with Block Generation) via HTTP/JSON-RPC
DESCRIPTION: Increases the Starknet Devnet block timestamp by the specified `TIME_IN_SECONDS` (relative amount) and immediately generates a new block. This increment is applied relative to the natural progression of time since the last block plus the provided offset. Use either the `/increase_time` HTTP POST endpoint or the `devnet_increaseTime` JSON-RPC method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.1/starknet-time.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
POST /increase_time
{
    "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS
}
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_increaseTime",
    "params": {
        "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Loading Devnet State via HTTP POST Request - Starknet Devnet - Bash
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates sending a POST request to the /load endpoint with a JSON body specifying 'path' to a dump file. If successful, it replaces the current Devnet state with the one loaded from the file. Dependencies: Running Devnet HTTP server with dump file available. Input: POST /load with JSON. Output: Updated in-memory Devnet with restored state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.0/dump-load-restart.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
POST /load
{ "path": <PATH> }
```

```
    "new_balance": 500000,
```

TITLE: Adding and Installing starknet-devnet Versions with asdf Version Manager - Shell

This method facilitates easy switching between multiple versions without manual builds.

CODE:

TITLE: Comparing Transaction Status Semantics in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: A markdown table comparing the difference in transaction status semantics between official Starknet testnet and Devnet. It shows how REJECTED and REVERTED statuses have different meanings in each environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.3.0/intro.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Tx status  | Official testnet                                            | Devnet                                                     |
| ---------- | ----------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- |
| `REJECTED` | validation failed; not included in a block                  | not used                                                   |
| `REVERTED` | validation passed but execution failed; included in a block | validation or execution failed; not included in a block`*` |

`*`: dummy zeroes (0) in tx info for block number and tx index
```

TITLE: Running Devnet with Automatic Block Generation
DESCRIPTION: Example of running Starknet Devnet with automatic block generation every 10 seconds, showing the timeline of transaction submissions and block creation events.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/blocks.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# t
$ starknet-devnet --block-generation-on 10

# t + 1s
# user: send tx1

# t + 4s
# user: send tx2

# t + 10s
# Devnet: block automatically generated, contains tx1 and tx2

# t + 12s
# user: send tx3

# t + 14s
# user: invoke empty block creation
# Devnet: generated block contains tx3

# t + 20s
# Devnet: block automatically generated, contains no txs (manual creation did not restart the counter)
```

```
    starknetCore = mockStarknetMessaging_;
}
```

TITLE: Installing latest Starknet Devnet with asdf
DESCRIPTION: Installs the latest version of Starknet Devnet using the asdf version manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.4.0/running/install.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ asdf install starknet-devnet latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling a Starknet Devnet Docker image with prefunded accounts
DESCRIPTION: This command pulls a Starknet Devnet Docker image that has been preconfigured with funded accounts, using seed 0 for consistent deployment. This provides a deterministic set of pre-funded accounts for development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.2/running/docker.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
$ docker pull shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs:<VERSION>-seed0
```

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
$ docker pull shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs:latest-seed0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Explicitly Enabling Request/Response and INFO Logging (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Similar to the previous snippet, this command sets RUST_LOG to include "REQUEST", "RESPONSE", and explicitly "INFO". This ensures that standard INFO level logs are shown along with request and response bodies. It serves as an alternative way to enable request/response logging while guaranteeing the INFO level is active.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.7/server-config.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ RUST_LOG="REQUEST,RESPONSE,INFO" starknet-devnet
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing installable versions of Starknet-Devnet using asdf
DESCRIPTION: This command lists all available versions of the Starknet-Devnet package that can be installed using `asdf`.  It queries the plugin to retrieve a list of all available versions.  Requires the `asdf` plugin for `starknet-devnet` to be added.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.3/running/install.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
$ asdf list-all starknet-devnet
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Increasing Block Time via POST API (Generates Block)
DESCRIPTION: Sends a POST request to the `/increase_time` endpoint to increase the block timestamp by a specified duration. Requires a JSON body with the 'time' parameter specifying the increment in seconds. This operation generates a new block, and the increment persists for subsequent blocks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/starknet-time.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
POST /increase_time
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieve Server Configuration via curl
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves the server configuration by sending a `GET` request to the `/config` endpoint and parsing the `server_config` property using `jq`.  Requires `curl` and `jq` to be installed. The server needs to be running at localhost:5050.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/server-config.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ curl localhost:5050/config | jq .server_config
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Selecting Account Class via StarkNet Devnet CLI
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the command-line option to choose between predeploying standard Cairo 0 (OpenZeppelin 0.5.1) or Cairo 1 (OpenZeppelin 0.8.1) account contract classes when starting StarkNet Devnet.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/predeployed.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
--account-class [cairo0 | cairo1]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Environment Variable Precedence Example with Starknet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates that CLI arguments take precedence over environment variables when both are specified. In this example, seed value 42 will be used despite the environment variable setting it to 10.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/running/cli.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ SEED=10 starknet-devnet --seed 42
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Stopping Automatic Account Impersonation with devnet_stopAutoImpersonate in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the JSON-RPC method devnet_stopAutoImpersonate to disable the automatic impersonation of accounts. The method requires an empty params object and returns an empty response.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.4.0/account-impersonation.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_stopAutoImpersonate",
    "params": {}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run Starknet Devnet from source (Cargo)
DESCRIPTION: This command runs the Starknet Devnet directly from the source code using Cargo. It compiles and executes the project.  Additional command-line arguments can be passed to the Devnet by appending them after `--`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.4/running/install.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ cargo run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Increasing Time via JSON-RPC
DESCRIPTION: The JSON-RPC equivalent for increasing block timestamp. Uses the devnet_increaseTime method to add the specified seconds to the current timestamp and generates a new block.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.3.0/starknet-time.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_increaseTime",
    "params": {
        "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Request/Response Logging with Explicit INFO Level (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Explicitly sets the RUST_LOG environment variable to enable logging of HTTP request and response bodies along with the INFO level for the Starknet Devnet binary.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/server-config.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ RUST_LOG="REQUEST,RESPONSE,INFO" starknet-devnet
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling Docker Image by Version
DESCRIPTION: This command is used to download a specific version of the Starknet Devnet Docker image from Docker Hub, corresponding to a crates.io version. Replace `<CRATES_IO_VERSION>` with the desired version tag.  Docker needs to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.1/running/docker.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
$ docker pull shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs:<CRATES_IO_VERSION>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Initial Start Time via CLI Argument (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Starts Starknet Devnet with a specific initial timestamp using the `--start-time` command-line argument. The provided `<START_TIME_IN_SECONDS>` must be a Unix timestamp greater than 0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/starknet-time.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet --start-time <START_TIME_IN_SECONDS>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Starknet Devnet in Fork Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to start Starknet Devnet in fork mode, allowing interaction with contracts from mainnet or testnet. The command requires a JSON-RPC API provider URL and optionally a specific block number to fork from.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/forking.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet --fork-network <URL> [--fork-block <BLOCK_NUMBER>]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sourcing a Configuration File and Running Starknet Devnet - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Runs the starknet-devnet command after sourcing a configuration file to set environment variables in the current shell session. The source command loads variables from the file (.my-env-file) before starting the instance. This approach reduces command-line length when using many options; the file must use shell-compatible syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.0/running/cli.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ source .my-env-file && starknet-devnet
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Binding Starknet Devnet to Localhost - Docker - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command allows users to specifically bind the Starknet Devnet container to localhost (127.0.0.1) on port 5050 using Docker. The only prerequisite is Docker, and this setup restricts access to the service so that only the local machine can connect. It is useful for local-only development or testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.4/running/docker.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ docker run -p 127.0.0.1:5050:5050 shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Response for Aborting Blocks - JSON
DESCRIPTION: The response from abort_blocks is a JSON object listing all aborted block hashes in order. This confirms the rollback, and the state reverts to the last accepted block prior to the specified starting_block_hash. The blocks are now only referencable by hash; further aborts or abortions of forked/origin blocks are unsupported.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.7/blocks.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "aborted": [BLOCK_HASH_0, BLOCK_HASH_1, ...]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Loading Configuration from a File
DESCRIPTION: This Bash script demonstrates how to load environment variables from a file and use them to configure Starknet Devnet. The `export` keyword sets environment variables inside the file. The `source` command then executes the file in the current shell, making the environment variables available to the `starknet-devnet` command. Using parentheses around the command will prevent environment pollution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.3/running/cli.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
export SEED=42
export ACCOUNTS=3
...

```

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
$ source .my-env-file && starknet-devnet
```

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
$ ( source .my-env-file && starknet-devnet )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling a Starknet Devnet image by commit hash
DESCRIPTION: This command pulls a Starknet Devnet Docker image tagged with a specific commit hash from the `main` branch. Replace `<COMMIT_HASH>` with the full 40-character SHA1 digest of the commit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.0/running/docker.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
$ docker pull shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs:<COMMIT_HASH>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Loading Configuration File for Starknet Devnet in Subshell
DESCRIPTION: Loads configurations from a file in a subshell to prevent environment pollution. This command ensures the environment variables set in the file are unset after Devnet exits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.1/running/cli.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ ( source .my-env-file && starknet-devnet )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Server Config via JSON-RPC
DESCRIPTION: Example JSON-RPC request payload to retrieve the Starknet Devnet configuration. Send this payload to the Devnet's JSON-RPC endpoint using the 'devnet_getConfig' method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/docs/server-config.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_getConfig"
}
```

TITLE: Pulling Latest Starknet Devnet Docker Image (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Downloads the latest stable version of the Starknet Devnet Docker image from Docker Hub. This is the standard command to get the most recently released build of the Devnet.

TITLE: Running Tests with Forge (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Executes the test suite defined for the project using the Forge test command. This command runs all functions marked as tests within the test contracts.

```
$ forge test
```

TITLE: Displaying Starknet Devnet Help
DESCRIPTION: This command displays all available command-line options for the Starknet Devnet. It provides a list of configurable parameters and their descriptions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.1/running/cli.md#_snippet_0

```
$ starknet-devnet --help
```

TITLE: Displaying Starknet Devnet Help
DESCRIPTION: This command displays the available command-line options for configuring the Starknet Devnet instance. It provides information on all configurable parameters and their default values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/running/cli.md#_snippet_0

TITLE: Pulling Starknet Devnet Image by Version - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command fetches a specific version of the Starknet Devnet Docker image using a crates.io version string. Replace <CRATES_IO_VERSION> with the appropriate version tag (e.g., 0.4.0). Docker must be installed. On successful execution, the locally available image will be tagged with the requested version.

TITLE: Running Starknet Devnet Container with Port Mapping - Bash
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to run a Starknet Devnet container with explicit port publishing from the container's internal port 5050 to a specified host port. This is necessary on non-Linux platforms like macOS and Windows to enable access to the Devnet server outside of the container. The user can customize the HOST and PORT parameters to restrict network accessibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.7/running/docker.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker run -p [HOST:]<PORT>:5050 shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs [OPTIONS]
```

DESCRIPTION: Shows how to explicitly set the logging level to INFO along with request and response logging. This ensures all three types of logs are captured.

```

```

TITLE: Enabling Automatic Account Impersonation via Starknet Devnet JSON-RPC (JavaScript)
DESCRIPTION: Invokes the devnet_autoImpersonate JSON-RPC method to enable automatic impersonation of all accounts that do not exist in the local Devnet state, simplifying testing with unknown accounts. This method does not require any parameters and returns an empty response. Requires Devnet to be run in forking mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.6/account-impersonation.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_autoImpersonate",
    "params": {}
}
```

```
{

}
```

TITLE: Using CLI argument to override environment variable

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Transaction Status Comparison Table in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: A markdown table comparing transaction status semantics between official Starknet testnet and Devnet, focusing on the REJECTED and REVERTED statuses.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.0/intro.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Tx status  | Official testnet                                            | Devnet                                                     |
| ---------- | ----------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- |
| `REJECTED` | validation failed; not included in a block                  | not used                                                   |
| `REVERTED` | validation passed but execution failed; included in a block | validation or execution failed; not included in a block`*` |
```

TITLE: Server Response to Gas Price Modification Request (JSON)
DESCRIPTION: This example contains the typical JSON response from the server after a successful setGasPrice RPC call. It confirms new gas price values that have been set, echoing back the supplied parameters. The response does not include error or status fields, and simply returns the updated gas price fields as unsigned integers. No other keys are present.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.2/gas.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
    "gas_price_wei": 1000000,
    "data_gas_price_wei": 10000,
    "gas_price_fri": 10000,
    "data_gas_price_fri": 10000
}
```

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
$ docker run --network host shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs [--port <PORT>]
```

TITLE: Impersonate Account - JSON-RPC Request (JavaScript)
DESCRIPTION: This JSON-RPC request impersonates a specific account address that does not exist in the local Devnet state. It uses the `devnet_impersonateAccount` method. The `account_address` parameter specifies the account to impersonate.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.1.2/account-impersonation.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_impersonateAccount",
    "params": {
        "account_address": "0x49D36570D4E46F48E99674BD3FCC84644DDD6B96F7C741B1562B82F9E004DC7"
    }
}
```

TITLE: Aborting Blocks via REST API (HTTP POST)
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to initiate block abortion using an HTTP POST request to the `/abort_blocks` endpoint. The request body must be a JSON object containing the `starting_block_id` (block hash or number) from which to start aborting blocks up to the latest.

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```

{
    "starting_block_id": BLOCK_ID
}
```

TITLE: Consuming L2 Message on Ethereum and Sending Response to L2 - Withdrawal/Deposit (bash)
DESCRIPTION: Consumes an L2-to-L1 message by invoking the 'withdraw' method via Forge's cast tool, providing contract and message content, gas, and private key. Then checks updated balance. Next, sends a deposit back to L2 by calling the 'deposit' method, again passing contract addresses, tokens, and requisite parameters. Each cast call and send assumes live contracts, funded accounts, and accessible endpoints.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/contracts/l1-l2-messaging/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cast send 0xe7f1725E7734CE288F8367e1Bb143E90bb3F0512 "withdraw(uint256, uint256, uint256)" \
     0x34ba56f92265f0868c57d3fe72ecab144fc96f97954bbbc4252cef8e8a979ba 0x1 0x1 \
     --rpc-url $ETH_RPC_URL --private-key $ACCOUNT_PRIVATE_KEY \
     --gas-limit 999999

git
cast call 0xe7f1725E7734CE288F8367e1Bb143E90bb3F0512 "get_balance(uint256)(uint256)" 0x1

cast send 0xe7f1725E7734CE288F8367e1Bb143E90bb3F0512 "deposit(uint256, uint256, uint256)" \
     "$CONTRACT_L2" 0x1 0x1 \
     --rpc-url $ETH_RPC_URL --private-key $ACCOUNT_PRIVATE_KEY \
     --gas-limit 999999 --value 1gwei

cast call 0xe7f1725E7734CE288F8367e1Bb143E90bb3F0512 "get_balance(uint256)(uint256)" 0x1
```

TITLE: Aborting Blocks with StarkNet Devnet HTTP API - HTTP
DESCRIPTION: Sends a POST request to the /abort_blocks endpoint with a JSON payload specifying the starting_block_hash. This operation aborts all blocks from the given hash up to the most recent, reverting their associated transactions. This is useful for simulating mainnet block reorganization or rollback scenarios. Only non-forked, non-already-aborted blocks can be aborted; otherwise, an error occurs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.7/blocks.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
POST /abort_blocks
{
    "starting_block_hash": BLOCK_HASH
}
```

TITLE: Flushing L1-L2 Message Queue via POST Endpoint using HTTP
DESCRIPTION: This POST endpoint '/postman/flush' processes and sends pending messages queued between L1 and L2 layers. Calling it triggers the transfer of enqueued messages in both directions. It requires no request body except for an optional "dry_run" boolean parameter. When "dry_run" is true, the flush operation simulates the message transfer without actually executing it, useful for inspection. A running L1 node is required unless "dry_run" is specified.

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```

```

CODE:
```
{ "dry_run": true }
```

TITLE: Pulling Starknet Devnet Docker Image by Commit Hash - Docker - Shell
DESCRIPTION: This snippet allows downloading a Docker image version associated with a specific commit for Starknet Devnet, using its full SHA1 git hash as the image tag. Docker must be installed beforehand. The <COMMIT_HASH> parameter must be the exact 40-character lowercase SHA1 hash of the target commit, providing precise image reproducibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.4/running/docker.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ docker pull shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs:<COMMIT_HASH>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Launching Starknet Devnet with Lite Mode (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Initiates the Starknet Devnet instance using the `--lite-mode` flag. This mode reduces resource usage by skipping the calculation of the block hash, suitable for testing scenarios that do not require this specific functionality. Requires the `starknet-devnet` executable to be installed and available in the system's PATH.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.0/lite.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet --lite-mode
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Logging Level - Starknet Devnet - Shell
DESCRIPTION: Explains how to set the Rust logging level (`RUST_LOG`) via an environment variable before running `starknet-devnet` to control log verbosity. The `<LEVEL>` placeholder should be replaced with a valid level like `INFO`, `DEBUG`, etc. This affects the detail and type of messages printed by the Devnet server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.2/server-config.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ RUST_LOG=<LEVEL> starknet-devnet
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Starknet Devnet Container using Host Network on Linux - Bash
DESCRIPTION: Provides a Linux-specific command example to run the Starknet Devnet container attached directly to the host network using Docker's `--network host` mode. This method exposes the container's internal ports directly on the host, avoiding the need for explicit port mapping. The port can be customized with additional CLI options. This approach is Linux-specific and should not be used on Mac or Windows.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.7/running/docker.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker run --network host shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs [--port <PORT>]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting RUST_LOG for Dockerized Devnet (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: This Docker command runs the shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs image and sets the RUST_LOG environment variable within the container. This controls the logging level of the Dockerized Devnet instance. Replace <LEVEL> with the desired logging level.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.7/server-config.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ docker run -e RUST_LOG=<LEVEL> shardlabs/starknet-devnet-rs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Starknet Devnet from Source (Default)
DESCRIPTION: Compiles and runs the Starknet Devnet project directly from its source code directory using `cargo run`. This command builds the project in debug mode and executes it. Requires Rust, Cargo, and the project source code cloned locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.7/running/install.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ cargo run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Starknet Devnet in Lite Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to start Starknet Devnet in lite mode, which skips calculating block hash for improved performance. This is useful for development scenarios where full blockchain functionality is not required.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.6/lite.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ starknet-devnet --lite-mode
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Increasing Starknet Devnet Time via API
DESCRIPTION: Sends a POST request to the `/increase_time` endpoint with a JSON payload containing the time increment in seconds. This increases the current block timestamp by the specified amount, generates a new block, and maintains this time difference for all subsequent blocks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.6/starknet-time.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
POST /increase_time
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "time": TIME_IN_SECONDS
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sending Mock L1L2 Message via Starknet Devnet Postman API - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This JSON request is posted to /postman/send_message_to_l2 to simulate sending a message from L1 to L2 without a running L1 node. Fields include l2_contract_address and entry_point_selector (both required and must reference valid deployed contracts/selectors), l1_contract_address, a payload array, paid_fee_on_l1 for fee simulation, and nonce, which must be provided explicitly. Inputs must be valid hex strings or arrays of hex strings. Output is a JSON object containing the transaction_hash.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.6/postman.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
{
    "l2_contract_address": "0x00285ddb7e5c777b310d806b9b2a0f7c7ba0a41f12b420219209d97a3b7f25b2",
    "entry_point_selector": "0xC73F681176FC7B3F9693986FD7B14581E8D540519E27400E88B8713932BE01",
    "l1_contract_address": "0xe7f1725E7734CE288F8367e1Bb143E90bb3F0512",
    "payload": [
      "0x1",
      "0x2"
    ],
    "paid_fee_on_l1": "0x123456abcdef"
    "nonce":"0x0"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calling devnet_stopAutoImpersonate JSON-RPC
DESCRIPTION: This JSON-RPC request disables the automatic account impersonation feature previously enabled by `devnet_autoImpersonate`. Once stopped, only accounts explicitly impersonated via `devnet_impersonateAccount` or existing locally will be recognized without signature errors. The method requires no parameters and returns an empty JSON object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.2.0/account-impersonation.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "1",
    "method": "devnet_stopAutoImpersonate",
    "params": {}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Mint Token Response - Starknet Devnet
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet showcases the response received after a successful minting request to the `/mint` endpoint in Starknet Devnet. The response is in JSON format and provides the `new_balance`, the `unit`, and the transaction hash (`tx_hash`).  The `new_balance` reflects the updated token balance after the minting operation. The `tx_hash` provides the transaction identifier.
SOURCE: https://github.com/0xspaceshard/starknet-devnet/blob/main/website/versioned_docs/version-0.0.6/balance.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
    "new_balance": 500000,
    "unit": "WEI" | "FRI",
    "tx_hash": "0xa24f23..."
}
```
